text: In a triangle ABC, point D is on side AB and point E is on side AC, such that BCED is a trapezium. DE : BC = 3 : 5. Calculate the ratio of the area of ADE and the trapezium BCED.

If a circle is provided with a measure of 19° on centre, is it possible to divide the circle into 360 equal parts?

options.B: Possible when one more measure of 20° is given
options.D: Possible if one more measure of 21° is given

In a trapezium ABCD, AB || CD and AD = BC. If P is point of intersection of diagonals AC and BD, then all of the following is wrong except
All of the following is true except:

options.A: The points of intersection of direct common tangents and indirect common tangents of two circles divide the line segment joining the two centres respectively externally and internally in the ratio of their radii.
options.B: In a cyclic quadrilateral ABCD, if the diagonal CA bisects the angle C, then diagonal BD is parallel to the tangent at A to the circle through A, B, C, D.
options.C: If TA, TB are tangent segments to a circle C(O, r) from an external point T and OT intersects the circle in P, then AP bisects the angle TAB.
options.D: If in a right triangle ABC, BD is the perpendicular on the hypotenuse AC, then (i) AC⋅AD = AB² and (ii) AC⋅AD = BC²
